programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Matters come to a head when Rich invades Ashley's territory in the jewellery and loan department.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley hires a woman to work at the jewellery counter, without consulting with Seth or Les. Questions about Ashley's skills are raised after suspicious transactions.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les orders Seth and Rich to clean up the warehouse to make room for new merchandise. When nothing is done, the owner has doubts that his children are cut out for business.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Jenny makes a series of extravagant bids to come out on top at an auction in Longview.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Veteran locker bidder Puffy - who also happens to be Ricky's mother - causes a commotion when she competes in a storage battle in upscale Haslet.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: For the Benefit of Mr Charles
programme.desc: Mary brings a mysterious friend to an auction, and Jenny adopts a bold new strategy.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction season ends with a record-breaking sale, and Moe chooses the one purchase his wife allows him to make each year.

programme.title: A Very British Road Trip with John Thompson and Simon Day
programme.desc: John Thomson and Simon Day learn to play darts, milk goats and perform magic tricks when they take a tour of Essex.

programme.title: A Very British Road Trip with John Thompson and Simon Day
programme.desc: John Thomson and Simon Day look back on their tour of Britain, and discuss what characterises its different counties.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth hatches a plan to get more customers through the pawn shop doors. His new idea backfires, and Les is forced to reconsider his choice of manager.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les's return proves a shock for Seth and Ashley, who have let profits drop in his absence. Back in charge, the manager cuts a deal that could increase profits.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Sarah Millican, Tom Allen, Arj Barker
programme.desc: Sarah Millican plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo, warming up the audience and then introducing routines by Tom Allen and Arj Barker.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Broadcaster David Dimbleby takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with investigative journalist Stacey Dooley and comedian Henning Wehn joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Stand-up comic and QI panellist Alan Davies is joined in conversation by Aisling Bea, Justin Moorhouse, Jo Enright and Jim Moir, aka Vic Reeves.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Jon Robins, Russell Howard, Reece Shearsmith and Tiffany Stevenson join Alan to discuss such varied subjects as Freddie Mercury's unusual birthday cake.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Adam Gendle travel around the country to complete a variety of outlandish stunts, beginning with an attempt to bounce a man across a lake and into a target.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Officers of Staffordshire Police are presented with a challenging situation in Burton when a late night reveller decides to go for an impromptu swim in the River Trent.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz head west to where the buffalo roam and the skies are not cloudy all day in search of the most perfect picks on the range.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon Bernier and his wife Lori continue bidding on storage units in Boston, and make one of their biggest finds.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori prepare for an explosive auction, where they compete to buy storage units.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike and Frank take picking to a whole new level when they come across people who are not afraid to go big when it comes to collecting.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank go on the road in search for a unique motorbike, only to receive some shocking news from an appraiser.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Steve is asked to build a scary villain rat rod in three weeks and a vintage-inspired charity bike for military veterans in just two weeks, but frets when the Vet Bike won't start.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May find the fastest way to get around London - bike, boat or car - in a race through the capital during rush hour. The Stig takes to the test track in the Caparo T1, the Aston Martin V8 Vantage Roadster is pitted against a man with three rockets strapped to his back, and Simon Cowell is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Cutting-edge documentary series following the Staffordshire Police force as they fight crime in the country's diverse and contrasting communities.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Steve faces his toughest challenge yet when he must design a tour bus that represents WelderUp while meeting the high standards of his business partners.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson test-drives two estate cars - the BMW M5 and Mercedes E63. Richard Hammond tries out motor-home racing, while James May pits an Alfa Romeo 159 against a man who crosses the Humber estuary without using its famous bridge. The Stig puts Honda's Civic Type R through its paces and former England rugby union forward Lawrence Dallaglio is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: In an edition first broadcast in 2007, Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May celebrate British Leyland's 40th birthday by trying to boost the reputation of the cars that once rolled off its production line. The Aston Martin DBS is put through its paces on the test track, Jennifer Saunders is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car and the team asks whatever happened to the beach buggy.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Nish Kumar, Holly Walsh and Cariad Lloyd join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an extended edition of the comedy panel quiz show, with questions touching on the world's deadliest hunter, a photographer hidden inside an ox, and a juggling otter. As ever, the panellists face fiendishly difficult questions, and points are awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Four famous faces go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games across the week, with comedians Nish Kumar and Al Murray, Radio 1 DJ Clara Amfo and broadcaster Anneka Rice the first contestants. A daily winner is declared following a quick-fire round at the end of each show, and the weekly scores are tallied resulting in an overall champion being crowned on Friday, when the victor chooses between a House of Games dartboard and a branded dressing gown.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guests Dara O Briain, Denise Van Outen, Rhod Gilbert and Vernon Kay, who try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Charles Dance, Stephen Mangan, Isy Suttie and Gok Wan join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Sarah Millican, Tom Allen, Arj Barker
programme.desc: Sarah Millican plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo, warming up the audience and then introducing routines by Tom Allen and Arj Barker.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Five new contestants - Iain Stirling, Joe Thomas, Lou Sanders, Paul Sinha and Sian Gibson - complete tasks under the watchful eye of Greg Davies and Alex Horne.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy panel quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions about lenses, lungs and legs. With comedian and The Last Leg co-host Josh Widdicombe, comedienne Jo Brand, Never Mind the Buzzcocks team captain and stand-up Phill Jupitus and regular panellist Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy panel quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on L-themed larks - a 'Liblabble', as he calls it. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are broadcaster the Rev Richard Coles and stand-ups Sara Pascoe and Bill Bailey.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A classic car fan with a love of the Jaguar E-Type reluctantly sends his dream car to auction, hoping to buy a motorhome with the money. Two Ford Escorts get Dave's pulse racing.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A widow reluctantly parts with her husband's treasured collection of Rolls Royces and Bentleys, and an impulse buyer finds one of the cars a new home.

programme.title: Medieval Dead
programme.desc: Tim Sutherland makes numerous discoveries as bones from the 1385 Battle of Aljubarrota, in which Portugal defeated the Crown of Castile, are forensically examined.

programme.title: Medieval Dead
programme.desc: Carbon dating of a skeleton found in East Sussex suggests the bones are from the Norman era, leading experts to consider whether the medieval man fought at the Battle of Hastings.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Full Steam Ahead
programme.desc: Historians Ruth Goodman, Alex Langlands and Peter Ginn relive the golden age of steam. They begin by exploring how the introduction of steam railways in the early 19th century created a domestic revolution, from the way people lived to the food they ate. Arriving at Ffestiniog Railway in Snowdonia, they find out how millions of tons of slate were moved down the mountain, while underground, Alex experiences the brutal conditions face by miners in the Llechwedd Quarry.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The history of pioneering modern-day mega structures, revealing that behind every seemingly impossible marvel of modern engineering is a cast of historic trailblazing engineers who designed new building techniques, took risks on untested materials and revolutionised their field. The first programme focuses on the aircraft carrier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A settlement in Argentina destroyed by floods, a town in the US that has been erased, and a Soviet dream-town that turned into a nuclear nightmare.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Acclaimed chronicle of the Second World War, beginning with an account of Hitler's ascent to power at a time when the Germans were stricken by humiliating military defeat, runaway inflation and economic depression. The Nazi leader's promises of regained national pride and prosperity struck a chord with millions of ordinary citizens, and he was elected on a tidal wave of popular support. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates conflicting accounts of the killing of Italian dictator Benito Mussolini in 1945.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The history of pioneering modern-day mega structures, revealing that behind every seemingly impossible marvel of modern engineering is a cast of historic trailblazing engineers who designed new building techniques, took risks on untested materials and revolutionised their field. The first programme focuses on the aircraft carrier.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. The moors and valleys of West Yorkshire were the home of, and inspiration for, the Brontes, the literary family who produced such classics as Wuthering Heights and Jane Eyre. Over four days, Tony heads out from the Victorian wool capital of Bradford and treks in a giant loop around what is now known as Bronte Country. From the birth of Charlotte, Emily, Anne and their brother Branwell in the suburb of Thornton, he traces their childhoods to the much-romanticised Bronte hub of Haworth, finding that the harsh reality of life in the 1820s was far removed from the fantasy world dreamed up by the children at their father's parsonage home.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Lost Treasure of the Templars
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates whether the Knights Templar hid their treasure, looted from Jerusalem, on an uninhabited island in Mahone Bay, Nova Scotia.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an exploration of Earth's vast seas, which cover 70 per cent of the planet's surface. In the first episode, millions of squid appear off the coast of California, gannets, whale sharks and dolphins hunt migrating sardines in the Indian Ocean, and thousands of turtles make the annual pilgrimage to lay their eggs in Costa Rica.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: The crew visits Germany to collect a multi-million-pound maintenance machine so large it will need to be loaded onto two trucks. Eric and Chris oversee a diesel-engine exchange.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A seemingly endless concrete line stretching through the French countryside, which sits as a monument to a discarded engineering advancement.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Acclaimed chronicle of the Second World War, beginning with an account of Hitler's ascent to power at a time when the Germans were stricken by humiliating military defeat, runaway inflation and economic depression. The Nazi leader's promises of regained national pride and prosperity struck a chord with millions of ordinary citizens, and he was elected on a tidal wave of popular support. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Documentary following the exploits of a family-run crew of heavy-haulage specialists as they transport the heaviest, longest and most precious locomotives around the world. Terry and Jason have been called in to move legendary steam locomotive Britannia. The 68-year-old vehicle has undergone a major restoration in Crewe and is scheduled to start running at the Severn Valley Railway.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Series exploring ruined engineering projects that have been put to alternative use, including the site of the Chernobyl disaster and a Nazi holiday complex.

programme.title: David Jason: Planes, Trains and Automobiles
programme.desc: The actor discovers the machines that made America. Here, he samples the luxury of 1930s aviation, drives the car that changed the world and climbs aboard a vintage steam train.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a North Yorkshire-based, family-run historic car auction business, which uncovers some remarkably rare vehicles in the picturesque village of Thornton-le-Dale.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Documentary exploring unusual rail networks from around the world, beginning with a look at trains in cities, including an inverted monorail in Wuppertal, Germany. With contributions from Susana Esteves da Fonseca.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: New World and Tina Charles perform on the vintage comedy and variety show, which includes sketches Patient, Wedding, Spoonerism and Hampton Wick.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Boyd is unsettled when Sarah Cavendish (played by Five Daughters star Eva Birthistle), an officer of equal rank to him, joins the team to investigate the disappearance of a banker who had been struggling to cope with losing his daughter to cancer. Though Cavendish's professional skills quickly prove to be a major asset, her new colleagues discover that a failed operation from earlier in her career is continuing to haunt her, and become concerned for her welfare. Trevor Eve stars in the first of a two-part story kicking off the final series of the crime drama, with Sue Johnston and Tara Fitzgerald.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: Kenneth Branagh returns to his Bafta-winning role of the Swedish detective in three adaptations of stories by Henning Mankell. Wallander moves into a new home with his girlfriend, only for their dreams of domestic bliss to be shattered when they discover a skeleton in the garden. He must find the killer if he has any hopes of getting his life settled again - and is surprised to discover the body was buried more recently than he first thought. Saskia Reeves and Sarah Smart co-star.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Winsford Walled Garden in Devon, to answer the owner's horticultural queries.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Joseph makes a shocking discovery, abruptly ending the sisters' excitement about the new clothing deal.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Brad Connor is devastated to learn he may be HIV positive, and makes a drunken pass at Marsha Stubbs. Joy Wilton discovers the joys of mixing work with pleasure.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The scales fall from Kerry's eyes when she sees David Radford kissing someone else, and Samantha fears the worst when a girl's body is washed up near where Abi's clothes were found. Adam considers the appalling prospect that the sniper could be one of the Sun Hill team, while Suzie fuels Andrea's jealousy about her closeness to Neil.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Diane begins her battle for custody of Jack but just when he's needed more than ever, Owen is nowhere to be found. Carlos persuades a reluctant Tricia to go to the breast care clinic, and Will's wife brings the children to the hospital, announcing that he will have to look after them while she goes to a job interview. Mickie endures a harrowing day as a patient dies after giving birth, and she ends up taking one of Donna's pills, with disastrous repercussions.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A boy sustains serious injuries when a grenade belonging to an old man explodes in an allotment, while another youngster suffers an adverse reaction after consuming deathcap mushrooms. Meanwhile, Kate's daughter Lorna disagrees with her about keeping Trevor alive in a vegetative state.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kerry exacts revenge on David Radford by sabotaging his planned armed robbery, but Irene turns the tables by producing an incriminating tape. Andrea and Gabriel are both given ultimatums and Adam is furious when information about the Sun Hill sniper is leaked to the newspapers.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ricky has a surprise for Sam which further irritates Frank, while Clyde shocks his father. Arthur gets a gardening contract.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Etta and Celestine are planning a family party, but the younger Traverniers are reluctant to attend. Ian is pleased that Hattie is paying him more attention.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The team are called out to help a man with his feet cemented inside a toilet, and the money the Watch raised to pay for a young boy's operation is stolen.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Snooker player Dennis Taylor asks Lovejoy for help finding a billiards table that once belonged to Mary Queen of Scots. Drama, also starring Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim spars with seductive jewel thief Philippa Vale - but fails to prevent her stealing a priceless diamond in the middle of an auction. John Nettles stars, with Liza Goddard.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Mrs Boswell has trouble with a neighbour, Billy has a new job and Aveline is offered the chance of a lifetime.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Mr Goldberg sets up an employment agency and tries to find new jobs for Mrs Slocombe and Mr Humphries. Classic comedy, starring Alfie Bass, Mollie Sugden and John Inman.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Judith goes away for the weekend, leaving Lionel and Jean with the house to themselves. Comedy about late-blossoming love, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That with Barry and Glenda?
programme.desc: Truly jumps to the conclusion that Barry is up to no good after he is spotted acting suspiciously, but his real motive for being in the woods with a suitcase is unfathomable. Long-running comedy, staring Mike Grady, Frank Thornton and Peter Sallis.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest is stunned when he realises that the fugitive seeking sanctuary at St Mary's is Inspector Sullivan - and the man is wanted for murder. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams, Tom Chambers and Sorcha Cusack.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.sub-title: In the Footsteps of a Killer
programme.desc: Another mystery for the cops on the Caribbean island of Saint Marie, where the sun shines all day and it seems half the residents are killers-in-waiting. However, it's all change for the team. Last week they waved goodbye to Humphrey Goodman. No one knows how Kris Marshall's character is bowing out of the show - will he walk off into the sunset with new love Martha, or will he meet a sticky end, like his predecessor Richard Poole (Ben Miller)? What we do know is that in his place is Ardal O'Hanlon as DI Jack Mooney, who first popped up in the two-part London special. His first Caribbean case sees the reopening of a seven-year-old murder when a tourist provides an alibi for the woman convicted of the crime.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The discovery of a Roman sword with traces of blood on it is linked to an unidentified, headless corpse found near Heathrow in March 2008. It leads the team members to a lock-up belonging to a bodybuilder called Mark Rix, who died of a suspected heart attack the same year, so they start looking for connections between the original murder and Rix's death. They are helped in their investigation by anthropologist Fiona Kennedy, for whom Dan begins to develop feelings - just as he is told his wife might be discharged from the secure hospital where she has spent the past several years. Tracy-Ann Obermann and Liz White guest star.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A wealthy land-owner's wife is strangled to death and her body dumped in a reservoir. Taggart and his partner Livingstone become suspicious when they discover the dead woman's husband was last seen preparing to leave for Switzerland - and carrying a large sum of money. Guest starring Alan Cumming.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug (2013)
programme.desc: The party of dwarves and their hobbit ally continue the quest to reclaim their lost kingdom, journeying through the forest home of ancestral enemy the elves and finally facing the dragon that drove them from their home. Meanwhile, Gandalf the wizard investigates the rise of a mysterious dark power. Part two of Peter Jackson's fantasy adventure trilogy based on JRR Tolkien's novel, starring Martin Freeman, Ian McKellen, Richard Armitage and Orlando Bloom.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and topical studio discussion from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: The dealers pitch up in Stoke-on-Trent, where Tim Hogarth falls for an art nouveau mirror and Stewart Hofgartner spends big on a rare gold watch.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of family and friends answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Julian, Jo, Chris and Holly pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Long-running soap following the ups and downs of village life amid the rolling scenery of the Yorkshire Dales.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Long-running drama with the residents of England's most famous cobbled street.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Barnaby is dragged along to the wedding of the son of Sarah's friend Hazel, the last thing he expects to find himself doing is investigating a murder. But when his wife discovers the body of the bride, Laurel, who has been squeezed to death by her own wedding dress corset, the detective must look more closely at his fellow guests. The victim's husband Gavin is convinced that his wife's death had everything to do with her outspoken nature on her radio show, so Winter's attention soon turns to her unique community of nocturnal listeners. Gavin's scorned ex-fiancee and local wedding dress designer Serena also comes under suspicion, and Barnaby and Winter's enquiries lead them to a local wedding fayre. Neil Dudgeon stars, with Kelly Brook, Nick Hancock and Liz Fraser.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: The interventions of the Security and Customs Services at the borders of Spain, whose staff are under the constant threat from drugs, weapons, and suspected terrorists.

programme.title: Alien Encounters
programme.desc: A war erupts between the quantum computer and the human-controlled computer Queen, and the US military tries to neutralize the hybrid children with electromagnetic pulses.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini prepares for the Monterey car show and gets his 1952 Muntz Jet out of storage to ready it for sale.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini is asked by a car enthusiast to sell a Maserati Bora and an S2 Bentley convertible.

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Terrifying Tornado, Free-Fall Fireball, Molten Metal
programme.desc: Footage of everything from human endurance and survival to calamitous engineering failures, including a devastating natural disaster.

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Unravelling Underwater, Skydive Scramble, Russian Rumble
programme.desc: More footage hair-raising disaster footage, including a dizzying perspective on a skydiving accident.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A military helicopter loses power and slices through the deck of a naval destroyer, and a racecar narrowly misses another competitor when it cartwheels across a track in Italy.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Bodies and motorcycles hurtle through the air after a high-speed crash, and tanks holding 15,000 gallons of crude oil explode after being struck by lightning.

programme.title: Big, Big Bikes
programme.desc: Part one of two. A celebration of the excesses of the vehicle, including its most outrageous machines and riders.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Chip Foose and a team of mechanics work on a 1956 Chevrolet Nomad for Jay Leno's friend Dave Killackey.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The manufacturing process of Berettas and cotton, and an insight into the complexity of the Paris sewer system.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Looking at whether the Nazis got to the moon first when a Russian probe discovers that something has disturbed the lunar soil before the arrival of the US or USSR.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Bike guru Henry Cole and ace mechanic Sam Lovegrove are in the Queen's realm as they visit a shed in the shadow of Windsor Castle. Will they find a royal bargain of a motorcycle?.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Back in Northern Ireland, bike guru Henry Cole and ace mechanic Sam Lovegrove discover some lovely vintage cars as well as some modern motors. What will they take home?.

programme.title: Demolition Man
programme.desc: When his former junkyard mate decides to end their 20-year feud, Lawrie seizes the opportunity to buy some stuff from him. Plus, there is a demo job in Torquay.

programme.title: Demolition Man
programme.desc: Lawrie heads off to transport one of his ancient steam traction engines to an interstate collector. Plus, Benny is task to deliver a window to a customer.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Steve Graham fights torrid weather conditions as he tries to create a road train, while Yogi's truck breaks down on a cross-country journey.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer combines his love of vintage Escorts and rallying by making a Ford rally car, and it is left to Edd China to try to make a profit on such an expensive build.

programme.title: Supertruckers
programme.desc: The Truckers have a tight deadline moving four huge army Viking vehicles over 200km. However, loading and securing 12.5 tons onto their trailers is not going to be easy.

programme.title: Live Darts: BDO World Championships
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day three from indigo at the O2 in London.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: In Townsville, Queensland, long-distance trucker Peter gets ready for a cross-country haul in which he has to move a mixed freight through bush, farmland and desert to Darwin.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a budget Nissan Skyline supercar and Edd China sets about transforming it into a home-made drift racer.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Cabinet-maker Alex resurrects a once-stunning 300-year-old chest that's only fit for firewood. Plus, taxidermist Chris is challenged to resuscitate a Victorian heron.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard decides that he needs something different to stand out from the competition. He and Tee head to Italy hoping to find some antiques that his rivals won't be able to match.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Tasmanian logging contractors the Bennett Brothers tackle forest tracks to move a huge tree winch. Elsewhere, a leaky fridge halts Woody's urgent frozen food delivery.

programme.title: Cruise Ship Disaster: Inside the Concordia
programme.sub-title: Cruise Ship Disaster: Inside the Concordia Update
programme.desc: The story behind the sinking in 2012 of the Costa Concordia off the island of Giglio, Tuscany.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The manufacture of ball bearings, cartoonists' ink and false eyes.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How Russian dolls are made, and the production of aloe vera and flags.

programme.title: The 685lb Teen
programme.desc: Justin Williamson is the most overweight teenager in the US and everyday life is tough. However, he has two goals - to get healthy and launch a singing career. This is his story.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Cases in which partners teamed up to commit murder, including execution-style killings by two taxi drivers in New Jersey. Plus, an insight into a new DNA identification technique.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: Detailing how one man's infidelity resulted in obsession, stalking, and ultimately murder. Series detailing crimes and criminals inspired by film and TV fiction.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of a respected Kentucky businesswoman, found bludgeoned and stabbed to death in her home. Detectives followed a long path to pursue her killer.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The Behavioural Science Unit is asked to profile suspects when the naked bodies of several women are discovered.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: Lieutenant Scott uncovers an illegal cache of constrictor snakes, raising concerns that the deadly predators are being traded, and an abused dog fights for its life.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown examines a dog that jumped out of a moving car to chase a cat.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown prepares to visit his parents, but receives an emergency call about a python that is struggling after swallowing something.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I've Stalked This Dress on Instagram!
programme.desc: Hayley Paige makes three unique dress in one day, while a bride is determined to have her design a gown for her big day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Mackenzie knows exactly what she wants - a dress that makes her look like Jessica Rabbit, so consultant Britney tries to find the perfect item.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Cancer survivor Joya's dream dress is beyond her budget, but her friends offer support. Ria knows exactly which gown she wants, but her picky entourage are not keen.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Alex Hynes tries to treat a Labrador-staffy cross that has been attacked by another dog. Plus, carers attend to an American bulldog which has eaten a whole packet of macadamia nuts.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The team pulls out all the stops to save a newborn foal when it is found with its abandoned mother.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Animal cruelty investigator Barbara Christiansen rescues a horse found lying in a pool of water after heavy rain.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms three more items reclaimed from a tip, this time making over an old street light, a 1970s sofa and a set of moth-eaten blankets.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A case in which a house erupted in flames, killing one person and injuring another. The survivor blamed a kerosene heater; the evidence at the scene did not support her story, and she was charged with arson and murder. Later, a renowned fire inspector checked the evidence and discovered the real culprit.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A cold case from 1957, in which a man committed several crimes in one night - including murder. California police followed numerous leads but eventually the case turned cold. Almost 50 years later, with the help of advances in computer technology and handwriting analysis, investigators made a breakthrough.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 18-year-old Zebb Quinn, who went missing in January 2000 shortly after completing his shift at a supermarket in Asheville, North Carolina.

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Criminal barristers Sasha Wass and Jeremy Dein examine historical murder cases in which those convicted went to the gallows pleading their innocence. In the first edition, they investigate the case of Charlotte Bryant, who was arrested and hanged for the murder by arsenic poisoning of her husband Frederick Bryant in 1935.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A woman who recently lost her father searches for the perfect wedding dress. Plus, a look at what happens when a bride-to-be changes her mind at the last minute.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Store owner Ronnie claims to know what a bride should or should not wear, and is not afraid to voice his opinions, even if they are not always welcome.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Wedding season gets off to a bumpy start when there is confusion over a bridal gown, and the salon opens with its monthly sample sale of designer dresses.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: During the sample sale, a brother and sister hunt for the perfect dress, and the new members of staff are put under pressure.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: To Buy or Not to Buy
programme.desc: Claudia's professional problems continue, resulting in more meetings. Plus, a woman from Buffalo brings her fiance to the store.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A woman travels from Romania and finds her ideal wedding dress in Kleinfeld Bridal Salon. However, it transpires she may not be able to afford it.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Part one of two. Disaster strikes when a bride's father is convinced his daughter's dress is not how they wanted it, but a designer saves the day by agreeing to customise the gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Part two of two. A crowd of women fils the salon in pursuit of the dream dress, while Claudia struggles with a client.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a Devon mansion and takes home the worst chair he has ever bought and, at a lace factory in Scotland, literally goes home with the kitchen sink.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms three more items reclaimed from a tip, this time making over an old street light, a 1970s sofa and a set of moth-eaten blankets.

programme.title: Being Reuben
programme.desc: Welsh school boy and internet sensation Reuben de Maid is chasing his dream of becoming famous. He reflects on the bullying he has endured both online and in real life.

programme.title: Being Reuben
programme.desc: Grandad Bampa takes the kids camping for the weekend. Later on, Reuben has a photoshoot for a brand-new beauty app and brings Bampa along to show him his world.

programme.title: Sister Wives
programme.desc: The Browns meet with a potential investor for their jewellery line, while Meri drops a bombshell that threatens her close relationship with another wife.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Say Yes to the Dress: Nightmares and Dreams
programme.desc: Fashion director Randy Fenoli and director of sales Nicole Sacco take a look at the inner workings of Kleinfeld Bridal salon. Plus, a selection of memorable moments from the series.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Detectives fear for the safety of a girl abducted from a trailer park, and struggle to pick out a chief suspect after discovering several sex offenders live in the area.
